import React, { Component } from 'react'; import { Fade } from 'react-slideshow-image'; import Syria from './assets/syriacover.jpg'; import Thai from './assets/thaicavecover.png'; import Crossword from './assets/nytcrossword.jpg'; class Portfolio extends Component { render() { const slideImages = [ Syria, Thai, Crossword ]; const properties = { duration: 5000, transitionDuration: 500, infinite: true, prevArrow:
, nextArrow:
}; return (

Portfolio

1 of 5

Internship

{slideImages.map((each, index) => (
Slide {index + 1}
))}
{/*
*/}

The New York Times

As a Graphics intern on the Immersive team, I prototyped 3-D assets to visualize AR moments, researched and tested the use of the Microsoft Hololens in future articles, and created cover images and diagrams as seen here and here. During the Maker's Week Hackathon, I also helped build the front end for our intern-led 3-D Crossword project.

Inspired by old New Yorker cartoons, I started my own cartoon instagram called Peng and Ink as an outlet to showcase my humor and creativity. It follows a potato-shaped, sassier, and much smaller version of me as I navigate the ups and downs of work, dating, and everything in between. If you love cartoons or just want a laugh, feel free to give me a follow!:)

) } } export default Portfolio;
